bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Walter C. Earle to H. H. Howard, September 2, 1923 [Enclosed in C0302058]

div1.p: Earle writes Howard about data referred to in his enclosed report, Yellow Fever in Puerto Rico.

div1.head: Letter from Walter C. Earle to H. H. Howard, September 2, 1923 [Enclosed in C0302058]
div1.opener:
Carter
COPY
Hatillo, P. R.
Sept. 2, 1923.
Dear Doctor Howard:
div1.p:
I am enclosing the data which I was able to gather
relative to the past incidence of yellow fever in Porto Rico.
Written records previous to the American occupation are very
scarce and in most cases rather unreliable and since most of
those who had personal experience with the disease either have
died or are not in condition to tell about their experiences,
the report is naturally rather brief.

Hoping that the enclosed information is that which
you desired, I am
